meanings.definition: Insularisms: expressions or language peculiar to a particular island or isolated community.
meanings.sent1: The book was filled with insularisms unique to the small island community.
meanings.sent2: She found it fascinating to learn the insularisms of the remote island's dialect.
meanings.sent3: The tourists chuckled at the insularisms used by the locals, finding them charming.
meanings.sent4: His speech was sprinkled with insularisms, making him sound like a true islander.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged the students to study the insularisms of different cultures for their project.

meanings.definition: Insularisms: attitudes or beliefs characteristic of an insular or isolated group.
meanings.sent1: The insularisms of the small town residents made them resistant to change.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the insularisms of the close-knit community when she moved there.
meanings.sent3: Their insularisms sometimes led to misunderstandings with outsiders.
meanings.sent4: The insularisms of the group created a strong sense of unity among its members.
meanings.sent5: He tried to challenge the insularisms of the group by introducing new ideas.
